movies.title: The People vs. George Lucas
movies.plot: Uses a courtroom debate approach to explore the issues of filmmaking and fanaticism around one of the industry's most famous franchises and its creator. The innovative film combines filmmaker and celebrity interviews with fan films - submitted via the film's site - to make this the world's first digitally democratic feature documentary.
movies.simplePlot: An examination of the widespread fan disenchantment with .

biography.bio: Joe Nussbaum was born on January 10, 1973 in the USA. He is a director and producer, known for American Pie Presents: The Naked Mile (2006), Sydney White (2007) and George Lucas in Love (1999). He has been married to Abby Seik since March 2003.
biography.name: Joe Nussbaum

actors.character: Himself - Director, George Lucas in Love

biography.bio: Damian Hess was born on December 3, 1973 in San Francisco, California, USA. He is an actor, known for Nerdcore Rising (2008), The People vs. George Lucas (2010) and Rock Band (2007).
biography.name: Damian Hess

biography.bio: Richie Mehta is a director and writer, known for Siddharth (2013), Amal (2007) and Le chemin du passé (2013).
biography.name: Richie Mehta

biography.bio: Brian Comerford is a digital media producer with a background in broadcast radio production and entrepreneurship. Since entering radio as a broadcast announcer in 1989, he has interviewed hundreds of subjects for his radio productions such as musicians, artists, authors, philosophers, and researchers, and he has produced, scripted and directed numerous episodes of live radio drama. Comerford was the co-founder of RadioValve.com, the web's first 24-hour techno radio station, and one of the first generations of webcasters. The company developed its own station management software, and was a case-study for the publication _Web Radio_ by Chris Priestman. He is also an underground electronic music producer and DJ with an extensive discography who has performed internationally as a solo artist and with a laptop "band". Comerford, with almost two decades of underground film and scriptwriting projects to his credit, recently co-directed, co-produced and co-edited the international documentary feature film, _Ink Music: In the Land of the Hundred-Tongued Lyricist_, shot in Tokyo, Japan. He has worked as a voice actor, an application developer, a journalist, an IT director, a gaming audio consultant, and a nutritional business owner, and has served as an Adjunct Professor at the University of Denver in the Digital Media Studies department where he also earned his MA.
biography.name: Brian Comerford

biography.bio: Dale Pollock was born in Cleveland, Ohio, and graduated at the top of his class from Brandeis Univeristy, and eventually earned his masters in communications from San Jose State University. In 1977, he began his career writing for the Daily Variety. He became the head film critic for the paper, until he was hired by the Los Angeles Times to be their chief entertainment correspondent, where he formed the Calendar section. He was nominated for the Pulitzer Prize in the early 1980's. He also wrote "Skywalking, " the biography of filmmaker George Lucas. In 1985, Pollock joined David Geffen's company as a development executive. He joined A&M films a year later, and was named president in 1990. He lead the company to financial and critical success, producing such films as "The Beast" and "A Home of Our Own." He is now the president of Peak Productions, lectures often at both the American Film Institute and the University of Southern California film school.
biography.name: Dale Pollock

biography.bio: Glenn Kenny is known for his work on The People vs. George Lucas (2010), The Girlfriend Experience (2009) and Solace in the Dark (2011).
biography.name: Glenn Kenny

actors.character: Himself - Editor, A Galaxy Not So Far Away

biography.bio: Anthony Waye was born on March 12, 1938 in London, England. He is an assistant director and producer, known for Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope (1977), The Elephant Man (1980) and For Your Eyes Only (1981).
biography.name: Anthony Waye

biography.bio: Richard Sandling is an actor and writer, known for Nina Forever (2015), Godless (2017) and The Comedian's Guide to Survival (2016).
biography.name: Richard Sandling

biography.bio: Film and Television degree from New York University. Graduated 1997 and began editing. Has been awarded 8 Emmys for Oustanding Sports Editing, Directing and Producing.
